quote_first: One, two, three, four, five, six… She wound each clock in turn, three turns each, putting just enough power in the springs to get them ticking in time for Mr Westcott’s inspection. Speaking of which…it was
quote_last: . Five minutes before Mr Westcott would arrive to inspect his clocks. Helena swallowed. She could hear footsteps thundering in the room below and the occasional exclamation from Stanley.
title: The House of One Hundred Clocks
author: A.M. Howell

quote_first: Billy doesn’t drive to the parking garage. The parking garage is done. At
quote_last: he parks on Main Street a few blocks from the Gerard Tower. Plenty of curbside spaces at this hour and the sidewalk is deserted.
title: Billy Summers
author: Stephen King

quote_last: and raining hard when I pedalled up to the bike stand just outside the forecourt of the station and dashed inside. I raced past the bookstall, where all the placards of the Yorkshire Post (a morning paper) read ‘York Horror’, but also ‘Terrific February Gales at Coast’.
title: The Lost Luggage Porter
author: Andrew Martin
